Added to Goldman Conviction Buy List today - target $52 Comerica a Conviction Buy at GoldmanSep 16 2016, 07:12 ET | About: Comerica Inc. (CMA) | By: Stephen Alpher, SA News Editor Contact this editor with comments or a news tipAnalyst Ryan Nash sees upside to the bank's recently-announced strategic plan to improve pretax earnings by $230M, and expects additional revenue and expense initiatives to be announced during Q3 earnings.Management has also said all options are open, meaning M&A is a possibility, which should give downside protection to the stock.He upgrades Comerica (NYSE:CMA) to Conviction Buy from Neutral and lifts the price target to $52 from $49. The stock closed yesterday at $46.66.

IMHO ……. Yesterday's decent dip was the current floor. The upcoming quarterly report isn't expected to be very good, and the bad news is already priced in. At the same time, CMA makes decidedly more that the dividend payment, and that coverage will remain robust. Look for a dividend bump, with the earnings report, in the neighborhood of 8-10% . 2020 ends with CMA at $73 .
